member.name: T:kCura.Relativity.Client.ArtifactManagerProxy
member.summary: ArtifactManagerProxy is used to perform CRUD and other operations on objects in Relativity.

member.name: M:kCura.Relativity.Client.ArtifactManagerProxy.#ctor(System.Uri,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{kCura.Relativity.Client.EndpointType},kCura.Relativity.Client.ArtifactManagerSettings,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the ArtifactManagerProxy class with a URI specifying the location of the Services API, a collection of EndpointType values for the connection, configuration values used to override client-side settings, and a Relativity user name and password for authentication.
member.param: URL that houses the metadata
The desired endpoint types to use for connecting
The single-value configuration overrides to be used over the app.config
Username used for non-Windows authentication
Password used for non-Windows authentication

member.name: M:kCura.Relativity.Client.ArtifactManagerProxy.#ctor(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{kCura.Relativity.Client.EndpointType},kCura.Relativity.Client.ArtifactManagerSettings,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the ArtifactManagerProxy class with a server name, a collection of EndpointType values for the connection, configuration values used to override client-side settings, and a Relativity user name and password for authentication.
member.param: Name of the machine, like dv-dsk-myBox.kcura.corp, that houses the metadata
The desired endpoint types to use for connecting
The single-value configuration overrides to be used over the app.config
Username used for non-Windows authentication
Password used for non-Windows authentication
member.remarks: The ArtifactManagerProxy attempts to connect to the Services API using each supplied EndpointType in the specified order until establishing a connection, or until no more EndpointType values remain in the collection. The values provided by the ArtifactManagerSettings object override those in the app.config file.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.ArtifactManagerProxy.DefaultServiceAPIPath
member.summary: Gets the relative portion of the URI that is used in combination with the serverName to construct a metadata endpoint address. This property reflects the default installation of the Relativity Services API.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.ArtifactManagerProxy.EndpointTypeExceptions
member.summary: Retrieves a collection that contains more detailed information about what failed during proxy construction. The data structure represents the following: (scheme) -> (EndpointType, Exception)

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.ArtifactManagerProxy.MetadataEndpoint
member.summary: Gets the URI of the endpoint used to fetch the metadata.
member.remarks: Because of internal URI scheme switching that may occur, this property may not return exactly the value supplied in the constructor, especially if a constructor accepting a server name was used. For example, if http://myserver.example.com/Relativity.Services was supplied by internal scheme switching took place, this property may return https://myserver.example.com/Relativity.Services.

member.summary: Gets the current state of the communication-oriented object.

member.summary: Occurs when the communication object completes its transition from the closing state into the closed state.

member.summary: Occurs when the communication object first enters the closing state.

member.name: E:kCura.Relativity.Client.ArtifactManagerProxy.Faulted
member.summary: Occurs when the communication object first enters the faulted state.

member.name: E:kCura.Relativity.Client.ArtifactManagerProxy.Opening
member.summary: Occurs when the communication object first enters the opening state.

member.name: M:kCura.Relativity.Client.ArtifactManagerProxy.Abort
member.summary: Causes an immediate transition from the current state into the closed state.

member.name: M:kCura.Relativity.Client.ArtifactManagerProxy.Close
member.summary: Causes a transition from the current state into the closed state.

member.name: M:kCura.Relativity.Client.ArtifactManagerProxy.Dispose
member.summary: Performs application-defined tasks associated with freeing, releasing, or resetting unmanaged resources.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.ArtifactManagerProxy.APIOptions
member.summary: Provides an instance of APIOptions associated with the current ArtifactManagerProxy instance.
member.remarks: This APIOptions object has its WorkspaceID property initially set to -1. Its Token property is initially String.Empty, but it will be automatically populated when a successful call to either Login() or TokenLogin() is made.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.ArtifactManagerProxy.ApplicationID
member.summary: Sets an optional application ID.
member.remarks: Used by internal REST applications to audit client usage information.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.ArtifactManagerProxy.DeviceID
member.summary: Sets an optional device ID.
member.remarks: Used by internal REST applications to audit client usage information.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.ArtifactManagerProxy.Repositories
member.summary: Used to access the group of repositories.
member.returns: A new IRepositoryGroup.

member.name: E:kCura.Relativity.Client.ArtifactManagerProxy.ServiceOperationFailed
member.summary: The ServiceOperationFailed event is raised when an error occurs while an operation is being attempted.

member.name: M:kCura.Relativity.Client.ArtifactManagerProxy.Login
member.summary: Establishes a session with the Services API.
member.returns: The session token, a string used to identify the current session.
member.remarks: The session token is automatically stored in APIOptions.Token. It must be provided as a parameter to all subsequent calls to the API.

member.name: M:kCura.Relativity.Client.ArtifactManagerProxy.LoginWithCredentials(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Establishes a session with the Services API.
member.returns: The session token, a string used to identify the current session.
member.remarks: The session token is automatically stored in APIOptions.Token. It must be provided as a parameter to all subsequent calls to the API.
member.param: The user name.
The password.

member.name: M:kCura.Relativity.Client.ArtifactManagerProxy.TokenLogin(System.String)
member.summary: Logs in using a token, establishing a session with the Services API.
member.remarks: The TokenLogin method uses a one-time token to authenticate. This one-time token can be retrieved from within an event handler or custom page. It must be provided as a parameter to all subsequent calls to the Services API.
member.param: The one-time use token.
member.returns: The session token, a string used to identify the current session.

member.name: M:kCura.Relativity.Client.ArtifactManagerProxy.GetAuthenticationToken(kCura.Relativity.Client.APIOptions,System.String)
member.summary: This method is obsolete. Do not use.
member.param: The APIOptions object containing the login token from the Login() call, and the workspace ID.
The email address of the user that is logged into Relativity.
member.returns: ReadResult object containing the authentication token.

member.name: M:kCura.Relativity.Client.ArtifactManagerProxy.GenerateRelativityAuthenticationToken(kCura.Relativity.Client.APIOptions)
member.summary: Generates Relativity Authorization Token from session token.
member.param: An APIOptions object containing the session token from the Login() call.
member.returns: ReadResult object containing the authentication token.

member.name: M:kCura.Relativity.Client.ArtifactManagerProxy.Logout(kCura.Relativity.Client.APIOptions)
member.summary: Terminates the session with the Relativity.Services API.
member.param: An APIOptions object containing the session token from the Login() call.

member.name: M:kCura.Relativity.Client.ArtifactManagerProxy.Create(kCura.Relativity.Client.APIOptions,System.Collections.Generic.List{kCura.Relativity.Client.ArtifactRequest})
member.summary: Creates the specified ArtifactRequests.
member.param: The APIOptions object containing the login token from the Login() call, and the workspace ID.
The ArtifactRequests to be created.
member.returns: Returns a ResultSet indicating the status of the overall Create request and results for each artifact created.

member.name: M:kCura.Relativity.Client.ArtifactManagerProxy.Read(kCura.Relativity.Client.APIOptions,System.Collections.Generic.List{kCura.Relativity.Client.ArtifactRequest})
member.summary: Searches for the objects specified in the ArtifactRequest list, and reads them.
member.param: The APIOptions object containing the login token from the Login() call, and the workspace ID.
The list of ArtifactRequests to read.
member.returns: Returns an array of Artifact objects.
member.remarks: In the sample code, the Field objects in the Fields collection indicate the values to return. If no Fields are included, then the Services API returns all available fields.

member.summary: Updates the specified ArtifactRequest objects.
member.param: The APIOptions object containing the login token from the Login() call, and the workspace ID.
The ArtifactRequests to be updated.
member.returns: Returns a ResultSet indicating overall status of the request.

member.param: The APIOptions object containing the login token from the Login() call, and the workspace ID.
The ArtifactRequests to be deleted.
member.returns: Returns a ResultSet indicating overall status of the request.

member.name: M:kCura.Relativity.Client.ArtifactManagerProxy.GetAdminChoiceTypes(kCura.Relativity.Client.APIOptions)
member.summary: Get a collection of Choice Type IDs for Admin Choices
member.param: The APIOptions object containing the login token from the Login() call, and the workspace ID.

member.name: M:kCura.Relativity.Client.ArtifactManagerProxy.MassEdit(kCura.Relativity.Client.APIOptions,kCura.Relativity.Client.ArtifactRequest,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int32})
member.summary: Updates Documents with Field values from a template.
member.param: The APIOptions object containing the login token from the Login() call, and the workspace ID.
An ArtifactRequest with a set of Fields from which the Field values will be applied to each Artifact
The ArtifactID of each item that will be edited
member.returns: MassOperationResult indicating the status of the MassEdit operation
member.remarks: The MassEdit method is useful for updating Documents with Fields that need to be set to the same values. It reduces network traffic by taking a list of ArtifactIDs rather than ArtifactRequests.

member.name: M:kCura.Relativity.Client.ArtifactManagerProxy.MassCreate(kCura.Relativity.Client.APIOptions,kCura.Relativity.Client.ArtifactRequest,System.Collections.Generic.List{kCura.Relativity.Client.ArtifactRequest})
member.summary: Creates new custom objects in bulk using Field values provided by a template Artifact.
member.remarks: MassCreate has a template Artifact, which includes a list of Fields defining each new object. In the template Artifact, the Fields are default values that can be overridden by providing a different value for a specific custom object. The template ensures that the fields are not repeated in the SOAP message. A custom object instance is created for each ArtifactRequest in the ArtifactRequests list.
member.param: The APIOptions object containing the login token from the Login() call, and the workspace ID.
An ArtifactRequest with a set of fields providing default values
A list of ArtifactRequests to be created. An RDO will be created for each ArtifactRequest in the list.
member.returns: MassOperationResult indicating the status of the MassCreate operation

member.name: M:kCura.Relativity.Client.ArtifactManagerProxy.GetProcessState(kCura.Relativity.Client.APIOptions,System.Guid)
member.summary: Returns information on the state of an active long-running process within the system.
member.remarks: The Guid represents the ID of the long-running process.
member.param: The APIOptions object containing the login token from the Login() call, and the workspace ID.
The unique identifier for the running process.
member.returns: A indicating the state of the running process.

member.summary: Cancels a running process.
member.param: The APIOptions object containing the login token from the Login() call, and the workspace ID.
The unique identifier for the running process.
member.returns: A indicating the result of the operation.

member.param: The APIOptions object containing the login token from the Login() call, and the workspace ID.
The artifactID of the batch set to create batches for.
member.returns: A object indicating the result of calling the process.

The artifactID of the batch set to create batches for.
Specifies if the proxy should monitor the running process.

member.summary: Imports a list of resource files for an application
member.param: The APIOptions object containing the login token from the Login() call, workspace ID must be -1.

member.name: M:kCura.Relativity.Client.ArtifactManagerProxy.MassCreateWithDetails(kCura.Relativity.Client.APIOptions,kCura.Relativity.Client.ArtifactRequest,System.Collections.Generic.List{kCura.Relativity.Client.ArtifactRequest})
member.summary: Creates new custom objects in bulk using Field values provided by a template Artifact. The results contain the IDs for the created artifacts.
member.remarks: MassCreate has a template Artifact, which includes a list of Fields defining each new object. In the template Artifact, the Fields are default values that can be overridden by providing a different value for a specific custom object. The template ensures that the fields are not repeated in the SOAP message. A custom object instance is created for each ArtifactRequest in the ArtifactRequests list.
member.param: The APIOptions object containing the login token from the Login() call, and the workspace ID.
An ArtifactRequest with a set of fields providing default values
A list of ArtifactRequests to be created. An RDO will be created for each ArtifactRequest in the list.
member.returns: MassOperationResult indicating the status of the MassCreate operation

member.name: M:kCura.Relativity.Client.ArtifactManagerProxy.MassCreateWithAPIParameters(kCura.Relativity.Client.APIOptions,kCura.Relativity.Client.ArtifactRequest,System.Collections.Generic.List{kCura.Relativity.Client.ArtifactRequest},System.Collections.Generic.List{kCura.Relativity.Client.APIParameters})
member.summary: Creates RDO instances based upon the Field values provided by a 'template' ArtifactRequest. The template provides the default values. An RDO instance will be created for each ArtifactRequest in the ArtifactRequests list. Any field values provided in an ArtifactRequest will override the defaults provided by the template ArtifactRequest.
member.param: The APIOptions object containing the login token from the Login() call, and the workspace ID
An ArtifactRequest with a set of fields providing default values
A list of ArtifactRequests to be created. An RDO will be created for each ArtifactRequest in the list.
A list of any number and type of additional parameters that API might require.
member.returns: MassOperationResult indicating the status of the MassCreate operation
member.remarks: Only the Fields defined in the template will be populated in the created RDO instances. Any Field defined in an ArtifactRequest which is not also in the template will be ignored. All RDO instances must be of the same ArtifactType

member.name: E:kCura.Relativity.Client.ArtifactManagerProxy.Cancel
member.summary: Occurs when the cancellation of an upload or download operation succeeds.
member.remarks: A Cancel event is not raised when an error causes a transfer to be cancelled.

member.name: E:kCura.Relativity.Client.ArtifactManagerProxy.DownloadComplete
member.summary: Occurs when a download operation succeeds.

member.name: E:kCura.Relativity.Client.ArtifactManagerProxy.Failure
member.summary: Occurs when a download or upload file transfer encounters an error.
member.remarks: The Failure event is raised in addition to an exception.

member.name: E:kCura.Relativity.Client.ArtifactManagerProxy.Progress
member.summary: Occurs when the percentage completed for an upload or download operation changes.
member.remarks: The percentage change from one Progress event to the next varies based on the specified chunk size and the size of the file being transferred. The cancellation of transfer operations depends on the Progress event and the CancelTransfer property included in the ProgressEventArgs.

member.name: E:kCura.Relativity.Client.ArtifactManagerProxy.UploadComplete
member.summary: Occurs when an upload operation succeeds.

member.name: M:kCura.Relativity.Client.ArtifactManagerProxy.Query(kCura.Relativity.Client.APIOptions,kCura.Relativity.Client.Query,System.Int32)
member.summary: Queries Relativity to find Artifacts matching the selection criteria.
member.remarks: A Query object describes the search and sorting criteria to use for objects of a given ArtifactType. It can return all or a specific sub-set of fields. The length parameter specifies how many results to return in the first QueryResult object.
member.param: The APIOptions object containing the session token from the Login() call and the workspace ID.
The Query object that indicates the query to execute.
The maximum number of Artifacts to return. Additional results may be fetched by calling QuerySubset.
member.returns: A QueryResult object that provides the first length number of items. If more than length search results are available, the QueryResult.QueryToken property will have a value.

member.name: M:kCura.Relativity.Client.ArtifactManagerProxy.QuerySubset(kCura.Relativity.Client.APIOptions,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Fetches additional search results after a call to Query.
member.remarks: When a Query returns a large amount of data of a type that supports paging, this method returns the first page of data and provides a QueryToken. The only way to retrieve subsequent pages of data is by passing a QueryToken to a QuerySubset call.
member.param: The APIOptions object containing the session token from the Login() call and the workspace ID.
The query token value provided in the QueryResult.
The starting index used to select a subset of Artifacts from the list of all Artifacts that satisfy the initial Query() call. The list index starts with 1.
The number of results to return.
member.returns: A QueryResult containing up to length search results.

member.name: M:kCura.Relativity.Client.ArtifactManagerProxy.ExecuteBatch(kCura.Relativity.Client.APIOptions,System.Collections.Generic.List{kCura.Relativity.Client.Command},kCura.Relativity.Client.TransactionType)
member.summary: Executes Create, Update, Delete, MassEdit and/or MassCreate commands within a database transaction.
member.remarks: Each command has a type and may operate on one or more ArtifactsRequests.
member.param: The APIOptions object containing the session token from the Login() call and the workspace ID.
A list of commands to execute.
Indicates whether the batch should execute within a database transaction.
member.returns: A list of ResultSets that contain the status of each command and an Artifact for each item operated upon.

member.name: M:kCura.Relativity.Client.ArtifactManagerProxy.ExecuteRelativityScript(kCura.Relativity.Client.APIOptions,System.Int32,System.Collections.Generic.List{kCura.Relativity.Client.RelativityScriptInput})
member.summary: Executes a Relativity Script configured in a workspace by the Relativity Administrator.
member.remarks: This method returns a RelativityScriptResult object that may include the status of the operation and the number of database rows affected by the script.
member.param: The APIOptions object containing the session token from the Login() call and the workspace ID.
The ArtifactID of the script.
The input parameters for the script.
member.returns: Returns a ResultSet that provides the output of the execution of the script.
member.remarks: The logged-in user must be a Relativity Script Administrator to use this method.

member.name: T:kCura.Relativity.Client.APIOptions
member.summary: Provides a session token and WorkspaceID for creating a connection to Relativity.
member.remarks: The APIOptions object receives a token returned by the Login method that identifies the current session. It also receives the WorkspaceID used to identify a workspace in Relativity. Except for Login, most methods exposed in the Services API take an APIOptions object as a parameter.

member.name: M:kCura.Relativity.Client.APIOptions.#ctor(kCura.Relativity.Client.APIOptions)
member.summary: Copy constructor for APIOptions. This is a deep copy operation.
member.param: The APIOptions object which will be copied.
member.remarks: If is null, this copy constructor works like the parameterless APIOptions() constructor.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.APIOptions.StrictMode
member.summary: Turn on StrictMode to return consistent fields for Read and Query.
member.remarks:
When StrictMode is false (the default), Relativity Services will return exactly the same fields as 7.4. When StrictMode is true, Relativity Services will return consistent fields for Read and Query. Some fields which were previously available in 7.4 may use different names (compared to 7.4) or may not be available at all.
When Data Transfer Objects (DTOs) are used, Relativity Services will use StrictMode=True under the covers for the operations on these objects.
member.value: False to maintain compatibility with 7.4. Set to true if you want to ensure that Read and Query return consistent fields.

member.remarks: This function overrides the standard ToString behavior.

member.name: T:kCura.Relativity.Client.ArtifactRequest
member.summary: Represents a request for an operation to be performed on an Artifact in a workspace.
member.remarks: An ArtifactRequest object can hold information about Documents and custom objects, as well as metadata about the workspace structure, including fields, choices, and folders that it contains. An ArtifactRequest object is a slimmed-down version of an Artifact object.

member.name: T:kCura.Relativity.Client.ArtifactTypeNameRetriever
member.summary: Retrieves an ArtifactTypeName based on a WorkspaceID and a Guid.

member.name: M:kCura.Relativity.Client.ArtifactTypeNameRetriever.#ctor(kCura.Relativity.Client.IRSAPIArtifactTypeReader)
member.summary: Creates a new ArtifactTypeNameRetriever.
member.param: A mockable object that implements a few simplified RSAPI methods.

member.name: M:kCura.Relativity.Client.ArtifactTypeNameRetriever.RetrieveArtifactTypeNameWithCaching(System.Int32,System.Guid)
member.summary: Gets the artifact type name base on the route value which we got from the URL. This may involve a call to RSAPI, in the case where the routeValue is an int or a Guid. A cache is used to minimize calls to RSAPI.
member.param: This is the workspaceID. The method will fail if workspaceID is -1, because the EDDS database does not support lookup of artifact type Guids.
This value identifies the artifact type Guid.
member.returns: The Artifact Type name for the route value.

member.name: M:kCura.Relativity.Client.ArtifactTypeNameRetriever.RetrieveArtifactTypeNameWithRSAPI(System.Int32,System.Guid)
member.summary: Gets the ArtifactType by querying for the ObjectType. There is no Admin-level ObjectType table, so you can't use a Guid for Admin-level artifacts.
member.param: This value identifies the artifact type. It can use any of our accepted conventions for passing artifact type, including the following: (1) artifact type id, a string that parses to an int (2) artifact type guid, a string that parses to a guid (3) artifact type name (4) artifact type name with a ~ character for a prefix.
member.returns: The Artifact Type name for the route value.

member.name: T:kCura.Relativity.Client.ArtifactTypeCache
member.summary: Caches ArtifactTypesByWorkspaceIDAndArtifactTypeGuid.

member.name: M:kCura.Relativity.Client.ArtifactTypeCache.#cctor
member.summary: Creates a new ArtifactTypeCache.

member.name: M:kCura.Relativity.Client.ArtifactTypeCache.GetArtifactTypeName(System.Int32,System.Guid)
member.summary: Gets the artifact type name for the given workspace ID and a string identifying the ArtifactType.
member.param: The workspace ID. Using -1 is not recommended.
A Guid to search for.
member.returns: The artifact type name is returned if it is in the cache. Otherwise, null is returned.
member.remarks: If you pass in EDDS-level artifacts (e.g. User), this function will fail because there is no EDDS.eddsdbo.ObjectType table mapping them to their Guids.

member.name: M:kCura.Relativity.Client.ArtifactTypeCache.SetArtifactTypeEntry(System.Int32,System.Guid,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the artifact type name based on a workspaceID and a string identifying the artifact type.
member.param: The workspace ID.
An artifact type name, or an artifact type name prefaced by a ~ character, or a string containing an artifact type ID, or a string containing a GUID in the form XXXX-XXXXXX...
The artifact type name. This is the official name with spaces, e.g. "Batch Set".

member.name: T:kCura.Relativity.Client.Choice
member.summary: Represents a Choice used as a value for Single or Multiple Choice fields in Relativity.
member.remarks: A Choice object is returned when reading or querying Single or MultiChoice fields. To set or update a Single Choice field, use the ArtifactID or ArtifactGuids properties on a Choice object. For MultiChoice fields, use a MultiChoiceUpdateValue object when creating or updating them. Pass a List of ArtifactID objects or GUIDs when setting the values for Choice objects on Create.

member.name: T:kCura.Relativity.Client.Constants
member.summary: Defines a static set of constant values.
member.remarks: Use Constants when required by the Services API because they may change without notice. For example, Constants are used during Document creation.

member.name: T:kCura.Relativity.Client.Constants.Document
member.summary: Constants related to Documents

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.Constants.Document.RELATIVITY_NATIVE
member.summary: Use this constant when reading a Document or downloading a native associated with a Document.
member.remarks: Use this constant when reading a document, and returning the value of the FileID column from the File table in the database for the associated native file. If there is no associated native file, then the returned field will have a null value. You can also use this constant as the value of the FileRequest.TargetField.FieldName property when downloading a native file associated with a document.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.Constants.Document.RELATIVITY_NATIVE_FILE_LOCATION
member.summary: Use to specify the source file location when creating a Document.
member.remarks: This constant is used as a field name for specifying the location of the native file on disk when creating a Document.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.Constants.Document.RELATIVITY_NATIVE_FILE_SIZE
member.summary: When reading a document, use this constant to retrieve the size (in bytes) of the associated native file. If no native file exists, then the returned field is null.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.Constants.RELATIVITY_TEXT_IDENTIFIER
member.summary: Used to identify the text identifier of the document.
member.remarks: This is usually equal to the Control Number.

member.name: T:kCura.Relativity.Client.Constants.Group
member.summary: Constants related to Groups

member.name: T:kCura.Relativity.Client.Constants.Group.GroupType
member.summary: Constants used for the GroupType property

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.Constants.Group.GroupType.SYSTEM_ADMINISTRATORS
member.summary: Indicates the special group which marks a user as a System Administrator. System Administrators have broad-ranging elevated privileges within Relativity.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.Constants.Group.GroupType.SYSTEM_GROUP
member.summary: This type is used for new groups. All groups of this type appear on the Groups tab in Relativity.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.Constants.Group.GroupType.EVERYONE
member.summary: Indicates a special internal group which all users are part of. This group is not visible on the Groups tab in Relativity.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.Constants.Group.GroupType.RELATIVITY_SCRIPT_ADMINISTRATORS
member.summary: Indicates the special group which marks a user as a Relativity Script Administrator. Relativity Script Administrators have elevated privileges for adding and modifying relativity scripts.

member.name: T:kCura.Relativity.Client.Constants.Tab
member.summary: Constants related to Tabs

member.name: T:kCura.Relativity.Client.Constants.Tab.TabDisplay
member.summary: Constants used for the TabDisplay property

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.Constants.Tab.TabDisplay.VERTICAL
member.summary: This value is used for a Parent tab because the child tabs are displayed in a vertical menu.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.Constants.Tab.TabDisplay.HORIZONTAL
member.summary: This value indicates that the tab is displayed horizontally across the web page.

member.name: T:kCura.Relativity.Client.Constants.User
member.summary: Constants related to Users

member.name: T:kCura.Relativity.Client.Constants.User.DataFocus
member.summary: Constants used for the DataFocus property

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.Constants.User.DataFocus.OFF
member.summary: This value is used when DataFocus is Off

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.Constants.User.DataFocus.ON
member.summary: This value is used when DataFocus is On

member.name: T:kCura.Relativity.Client.Constants.Directives
member.summary: Constants used in place of a field name, which direct the Services API to return a special set of fields.

member.name: T:kCura.Relativity.Client.Credential
member.summary: Represents a Credential used as a value for Single or Multiple Credential fields in Relativity.
member.remarks: INTERNAL USE ONLY A Credential object is returned when reading or querying Single or MultiCredential fields. To set or update a Single Credential field, use the ArtifactID or ArtifactGuids properties on a Credential object. For MultiCredential fields, use a MultiCredentialUpdateValue object when creating or updating them. Pass a List of ArtifactID objects or GUIDs when setting the values for Credential objects on Create.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.Artifact.ArtifactID
member.summary: Represents a unique identifier for an Artifact.
member.remarks: When an Artifact is submitted to the web services for a read, update, delete, or query operation, it must have a value for at least one of these properties: ArtifactID or Guids

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.Artifact.Guids
member.summary: Provides a list of GUIDs used to identify an Artifact.
member.remarks: When an Artifact is submitted to the web services for a read, update, delete, or query operation, it must have a value for at least one of these properties: ArtifactID or Guids

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.Artifact.ParentArtifact
member.summary: Indicates the parent of an Artifact.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.Artifact.ArtifactTypeID
member.summary: Represents the identifier for the type of item that the Artifact represents.
member.remarks: When an Artifact is submitted to the web services for a read, update, delete, or query operation, it must have a value for at least one of these properties: ArtifactTypeID, ArtifactTypeName, or ArtifactTypeGuids.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.Artifact.ArtifactTypeName
member.summary: Indicates name of the ArtifactType used to define the Artifact.
member.remarks: When an Artifact is submitted to the web services for a read, update, delete, or query operation, it must have a value for at least one of these properties: ArtifactTypeID, ArtifactTypeName, or ArtifactTypeGuids.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.Artifact.ArtifactTypeGuids
member.summary: Provides a list of GUIDs defined for the ArtifactType.
member.remarks: When an Artifact is submitted to the web services for a read, update, delete, or query operation, it must have a value for at least one of these properties: ArtifactTypeID, ArtifactTypeName, or ArtifactTypeGuids.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.Artifact.IsStatic
member.summary: Specifies whether the type of the artifact represented by this DTO can be modified by the user.
member.remarks: A static artifact is an artifact whose fields are predefined by Relativity, such as "User" or "Choice". You can modify the data in a static artifact but you can't add a new field to it, for example you can't add "MaidenName" as a field on "User". In contrast, for Documents and other dynamic objects, you can add new fields to the artifact type.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.Artifact.TextIdentifier
member.summary: Indicates the value of the IdentifierFieldName field available in Fields property of the Artifact. This field may also be available as a Name property for many Artifacts.

member.name: M:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.Artifact.FindPreferredRelativityTextIdentifierField(System.Collections.Generic.List{kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.FieldValue})
member.summary: Return the field which is BOTH named Relativity Text Identifier and also has a category of Identifier. If no such field exists, return the first field with a category of Identifier. If no such field exists, return the first field with the name "Relativity Text Identifier"

member.summary: Creates a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.Batch.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the given ArtifactID.
member.param: An integer which uniquely identifier this Batch.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.Batch.Name
member.summary: Represents the name of a batch as a string.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.Batch.AssignedTo
member.summary: Indicates the user who the batch is assigned to.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.Batch.BatchSet
member.summary: Indicates the batch set that the batch belongs to.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.Batch.BatchStatus
member.summary: Indicates the status of the batch.
member.remarks: The batch status may be blank, in progress, or completed. In progress indicates that a user has checked out the batch, while Completed indicates that batch has been checked in.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.Batch.Reviewed
member.summary: Represents the number of documents in the batch that have been reviewed.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.Batch.BatchSize
member.summary: Indicates the number of documents in a batch.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.Batch.BatchUnit
member.summary: Represents the batch unit assigned to the batch. The batch unit is an optional field used for grouping similar documents in the same batch.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.Batch.BatchNumber
member.summary: Represents a number assigned to batch.
member.remarks: This value is assigned in sequential order to each batch in a batch set. The ordering begins with number 1. The BatchNumber is a component of the name assigned to a batch.

member.name: T:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.BatchSet
member.summary: Represents a batch set, which contains multiple groups of documents called batches.
member.remarks: When creating BatchSet, you are required to set the Name, MaximumBatchSize, BatchPrefix, and BatchDataSource fields.

member.name: M:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.BatchSet.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.BatchSet.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the given ArtifactID.
member.param: An integer which uniquely identifier this BatchSet.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.BatchSet.Name
member.summary: Represents the name of a batch set as a string.
member.remarks: This updatable field is required when creating a BatchSet.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.BatchSet.MaximumBatchSize
member.summary: Determines the maximum number of documents in a single batch.
member.remarks: This updatable field is required when creating a BatchSet.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.BatchSet.BatchPrefix
member.summary: Represents a batch prefix for this batch set. The name of a batch contains this prefix followed by the batch numbering.
member.remarks: This updatable field is required when creating a BatchSet.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.BatchSet.AutoBatch
member.summary: Indicates whether the batch set automatically generates batches.
member.remarks: This updatable field is set to False by default.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.BatchSet.PreconvertDocuments
member.summary: Indicates whether a batch set should have its documents converted upon batching.
member.remarks: If batching occurs via RSAPI, this field is not respected.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.BatchSet.MinimumBatchSize
member.summary: Determines the smallest number of documents in a single batch.
member.remarks: This updatable field is only used when AutoBatch on a BatchSet is set to True.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.BatchSet.AutoCreateRateMinutes
member.summary: Represents how frequently (in minutes) the system will attempt to create batches.
member.remarks: This updatable field is only used when AutoBatch on a BatchSet is set to True.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.BatchSet.LastSuccessfulRun
member.summary: Indicates the last successful run for a batch set. This field is read-only.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.BatchSet.LastErrorReported
member.summary: Indicates the last error reported for a batch set. This field is read-only.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.BatchSet.DocumentsToBeBatched
member.summary: Represents the remaining documents submitted for batching, which do not meet the minimum batch size.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.BatchSet.Status
member.summary:
Represents the status of a batch set.
Value Description
-1 Pending
-2 Processing
-3 Error
Positive number Number of batches processed

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.BatchSet.BatchUnitField
member.summary: Represents an optional field used for grouping similar documents in the same batch.
member.remarks: Documents with different values in their batch unit fields are not included in the same batch.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.BatchSet.FamilyField
member.summary: Represents the workspace group identifier.
member.remarks: When this identifier is set, documents in the same family are added to a single batch, which may exceed the number of documents specified in the MaximumBatchSize.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.BatchSet.ReviewedField
member.summary: Indicates the Yes/No, Single-Choice, or Multi-Choice field that Relativity monitors during a review. A count is incremented for each document in a batch coded with a value for the specified field.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.BatchSet.BatchDataSource
member.summary: Represents a saved search containing documents to batch.
member.remarks: This updatable field is required when creating a BatchSet. If the saved search references a dtSearch or Relativity Analytics index, the index must be active.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.Choice.Notes

member.summary: Determines the filter type available for the field.
member.remarks: This property is read-only. Available filter types are None or List. A List filters a drop-down list of all values assigned to the field in a workspace, and allows the user to select one for filtering. This property is only used for Single Choice lists and Yes/No fields.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.Group.GroupType
member.summary:
Represents a specific category of users, such as system administrators.
Value Description
1 System Administrators
2 System Group
4 Everyone
5 Relativity Script Administrators
member.remarks: Use 2 (System Group) to create a new group. Constants have been defined for these values.

member.summary: Represents the name of a group as a string.

member.summary: Provides a list of users assigned to a group. This field is updatable.

member.summary: Provides a list of workspaces where this group has been added.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.Group.WorkspaceGroupIDs
member.summary: Returns a list mapping the group's ArtifactIDs to their corresponding workspace ArtifactIDs.
member.remarks: Group have two types of ArtifactIDs. Each Group has an ArtifactID in the master EDDS database, and a separate ArtifactID for each workspace. The WorkspaceGroupIDs property returns a mapping of these ArtifactIDs to their corresponding workspaces.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.Group.Client
member.summary: Represents the client associated with this group.
member.remarks: This updatable field is required when creating a Group.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.RelativityApplication.UserFriendlyURL
member.summary: Gets or sets the string for the user-friendly URL used to reference custom pages in a Relativity application.
member.remarks: When you set the UserFriendlyURL property on an application, users see custom page URLs that contain this readable text instead of the application GUID. You can continue to reference custom pages using the user-friendly URL or the URL that contains the application GUID.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.RelativityApplication.GlobalApplication
member.summary: Gets or sets the string for the Global Application Flag.
member.remarks: When you set the GlobalApplication to true for an application, it can only be installed to the application library at the admin level.

member.summary: Represents a script defined through the Scripts tab in Relativity.
member.remarks: The RelativityScript class supports read and query operations.

member.summary: Provides a mechanism for locking the script.

member.remarks: This setting is entered between the <name></name> tags in the script body.

member.summary: Indicates the Relativity applications associated with the script.

member.summary: Identifies the version of the script.
member.remarks: This setting is entered between the <version></version> tags in the script body.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.ArtifactFieldNames.SystemLastModifiedBy

member.summary: Indicates the value of the IdentifierFieldName field available in Fields property of the Artifact. This field may also be available as a Name property for many Artifacts.

member.summary: Keywords.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.ArtifactFieldNames.Notes

member.name: T:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.BatchFieldNames
member.summary: The string names of fields used on Batch.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.BatchFieldNames.Name
member.summary: Represents the name of a batch as a string.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.BatchFieldNames.AssignedTo
member.summary: Indicates the user who the batch is assigned to.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.BatchFieldNames.BatchSet
member.summary: Indicates the batch set that the batch belongs to.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.BatchFieldNames.BatchStatus
member.summary: Indicates the status of the batch.
member.remarks: The batch status may be blank, in progress, or completed. In progress indicates that a user has checked out the batch, while Completed indicates that batch has been checked in.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.BatchFieldNames.Reviewed
member.summary: Represents the number of documents in the batch that have been reviewed.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.BatchFieldNames.BatchSize
member.summary: Indicates the number of documents in a batch.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.BatchFieldNames.BatchUnit
member.summary: Represents the batch unit assigned to the batch. The batch unit is an optional field used for grouping similar documents in the same batch.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.BatchFieldNames.BatchNumber
member.summary: Represents a number assigned to batch.
member.remarks: This value is assigned in sequential order to each batch in a batch set. The ordering begins with number 1. The BatchNumber is a component of the name assigned to a batch.

member.name: T:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.BatchSetFieldNames
member.summary: The string names of fields used on Batch Sets.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.BatchSetFieldNames.Name
member.summary: Represents the name of a batch set as a string.
member.remarks: This updatable field is required when creating a BatchSet.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.BatchSetFieldNames.MaximumBatchSize
member.summary: Determines the maximum number of documents in a single batch.
member.remarks: This updatable field is required when creating a BatchSet.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.BatchSetFieldNames.BatchPrefix
member.summary: Represents a batch prefix for this batch set. The name of a batch contains this prefix followed by the batch numbering.
member.remarks: This updatable field is required when creating a BatchSet.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.BatchSetFieldNames.AutoBatch
member.summary: Indicates whether the batch set automatically generates batches.
member.remarks: This updatable field is set to False by default.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.BatchSetFieldNames.MinimumBatchSize
member.summary: Determines the smallest number of documents in a single batch.
member.remarks: This updatable field is only used when AutoBatch on a BatchSet is set to True.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.BatchSetFieldNames.AutoCreateRateMinutes
member.summary: Represents how frequently (in minutes) the system will attempt to create batches.
member.remarks: This updatable field is only used when AutoBatch on a BatchSet is set to True.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.BatchSetFieldNames.LastSuccessfulRun
member.summary: Indicates the last successful run for a batch set. This field is read-only.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.BatchSetFieldNames.LastErrorReported
member.summary: Indicates the last error reported for a batch set. This field is read-only.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.BatchSetFieldNames.DocumentsToBeBatched
member.summary: Represents the remaining documents submitted for batching, which do not meet the minimum batch size.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.BatchSetFieldNames.Status
member.summary:
/// Represents the status of a batch.
Value Description
-1 Pending
-2 Processing
-3 Error
Positive number The number of batches which have been processed

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.BatchSetFieldNames.BatchUnitField
member.summary: Represents an optional field used for grouping similar documents in the same batch.
member.remarks: Documents with different values in their batch unit fields are not included in the same batch.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.BatchSetFieldNames.FamilyField
member.summary: Represents the workspace group identifier.
member.remarks: When this identifier is set, documents in the same family are added to a single batch, which may exceed the number of documents specified in the MaximumBatchSize.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.BatchSetFieldNames.BatchDataSource
member.summary: Represents a saved search containing documents to batch.
member.remarks: This updatable field is required when creating a BatchSet. If the saved search references a dtSearch or Relativity Analytics index, the index must be active.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.BatchSetFieldNames.ReviewedField
member.summary: Indicates the Yes/No, Single-Choice, or Multi-Choice field that Relativity monitors during a review. A count is incremented for each document in a batch coded with a value for the specified field.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.BatchSetFieldNames.PreConvertDocuments
member.summary: Indicates the Yes/No, field that keeps track of whether a batch set should have its documents converted upon Batching. Note if Batching occurs via RSAPI, this field is not respected.

member.name: T:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.ChoiceFieldNames
member.summary: The string names of fields used on Choices.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.ChoiceFieldNames.ChoiceTypeID
member.summary: Indicates an identifier of the ChoiceType for a Choice field.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.ChoiceFieldNames.Name

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.ChoiceFieldNames.KeyboardShortcut

member.name: T:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.DocumentFieldNames
member.summary: The string names of fields used on Documents.

member.summary: Specifies the local path for the native file.
member.remarks: This property is set only when a Document is created. It can't be used as a query condition.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.DocumentFieldNames.FileIcon
member.summary: Represents the file icon associated with the document.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.DocumentFieldNames.FolderName
member.summary: Indicates the name of the folder in Relativity, where the document is located.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.DocumentFieldNames.HasImages
member.summary: Indicates whether images of the document exist.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.DocumentFieldNames.HasInlineTags
member.summary: Indicates whether inline tags have been applied to the document.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.DocumentFieldNames.HasNative
member.summary: Indicates whether a native file exists for the document.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.DocumentFieldNames.RelativityImageCount
member.summary: Provides the number of images associated with a document.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.DocumentFieldNames.RelativityNativeTimeZoneOffset
member.summary: Indicates the native time zone offset of the document.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.DocumentFieldNames.RelativityNativeType
member.summary: Indicates the type of native file for a document.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.DocumentFieldNames.SupportedByViewer
member.summary: Indicates whether the Relativity viewer supports the native file type of a document.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.DocumentFieldNames.Batch
member.summary: Indicates the batch that the document is assigned to.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.DocumentFieldNames.Batch_BatchSet
member.summary: Indicates the batch set that the document is assigned to.
member.remarks: This field can't be used as a query condition. However, the Services API will return query results for it.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.DocumentFieldNames.Batch_AssignedTo
member.summary: Indicates the user assigned to the batch that contains this document.
member.remarks: This field can't be used as a query condition. However, the Services API will return query results for it.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.DocumentFieldNames.Batch_Status
member.summary: Indicates the status of the batch.
member.remarks: The batch status may be In Progress, or Completed. In Progress indicates that a user has checked out the batch, while Completed indicates the batch has been checked in.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.DocumentFieldNames.TimeZoneField
member.summary: Lists the ArtifactID representing the time zone of the document.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.DocumentFieldNames.ImageQCStatus
member.summary: Indicates whether the document's images, if any exist, are hidden for QC review.

member.name: T:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.UserFieldNames
member.summary: The string names of fields used on Users.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.UserFieldNames.AdvancedSearchPublicByDefault
member.summary: Indicates whether saved searches created by the user are public by default.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.UserFieldNames.AuthenticationData
member.summary: Indicates the authentication method for the user, such as RSA, SSL, or Active Directory.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.UserFieldNames.BetaUser
member.summary: Indicates whether or not this is a beta user.
member.remarks: This field is required when creating a user.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.UserFieldNames.ChangePassword
member.summary: Indicates whether a user can update the Relativity password.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.UserFieldNames.ChangePasswordNextLogin
member.summary: Indicates whether a user must update the Relativity password on next login.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.UserFieldNames.ChangeSettings
member.summary: Indicates whether the user can change settings, such as name, email address, item list page length, and others.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.UserFieldNames.Client
member.summary: Represents the client associated with this user.
member.remarks: This updatable field is required when creating a User.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.UserFieldNames.DataFocus
member.summary: Controls whether or not the workspace name is displayed at the top of the Relativity web UI.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.UserFieldNames.DefaultSelectedFileType
member.summary: Provides the Choice of the default file type that will be displayed in the viewer.
member.remarks: This updatable field is required when creating a User.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.UserFieldNames.DocumentSkip
member.summary: Provides the Choice of the document skip value, which advances the user to the next document when the view conditions are met.
member.remarks: This updatable field is required when creating a User.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.UserFieldNames.EmailAddress
member.summary: Represents the email address of a user as a string.
member.remarks: This updatable field is required when creating a User.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.UserFieldNames.EnforceViewerCompatibility
member.summary: Indicates whether a user is required to download a new version of the viewer when available.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.UserFieldNames.FirstName
member.summary: Represents the first name of a user as a string.
member.remarks: This updatable field is required when creating a User.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.UserFieldNames.FullName
member.summary: Represents the first and last name of a user as a string. It is read-only.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.UserFieldNames.Groups
member.summary: Provides a list of groups that the user has been added to.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.UserFieldNames.InvalidLoginAttempts

member.remarks: This updatable field is required when creating a User.

member.summary: Determines whether keyboard shortcuts are available to the user in the viewer.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.UserFieldNames.NativeViewerCacheAhead
member.summary: Determines whether the next native document is preloaded in the viewer.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.UserFieldNames.Password
member.summary: Contains the new value for a password assigned during a create or update operation.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.UserFieldNames.PasswordAction
member.summary: Indicates how a password is assigned to the user.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.UserFieldNames.PasswordLastResetOn
member.summary: Indicates the date when the user's password was last reset.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.UserFieldNames.RelativityAccess
member.summary: Indicates whether a user will be alloed to log in to Relativity.
member.remarks: This updatable field is required when creating a User.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.UserFieldNames.DisableDate
member.summary: Indicates the date and time when a user's access will be disabled UTC.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.UserFieldNames.SendPasswordTo

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.UserFieldNames.ShowFilters
member.summary: Determines whether the Show Filters option is displayed in the Relativity web UI.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.UserFieldNames.SkipDefaultPreference
member.summary: Indicates whether to advance to the next document that matches the view conditions or to display all documents in the queue.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.UserFieldNames.TrustedIPs
member.summary: Determines the trusted IP addresses for a user.
member.remarks: When a user attempts to log in from an unauthorized IP address, the authentication fails.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.UserFieldNames.Type
member.summary: Provides the Choice of the user type, such as internal or external.
member.remarks: This updatable field is required when creating a User.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.UserFieldNames.Workspaces
member.summary: Provides a list of workspaces that this user can access.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.UserFieldNames.WorkspaceUserIDs
member.summary: Returns a list mapping the user's ArtifactIDs to their corresponding workspace ArtifactIDs.
member.remarks: Users have two types of ArtifactIDs. Each User has an ArtifactID in the master EDDS database, and a separate ArtifactID for each workspace. The WorkspaceUserIDs property returns a mapping of these ArtifactIDs to their corresponding workspaces.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.UserFieldNames.DocumentViewer
member.summary: Provides the Choice of the document viewer that will be used to render documents in the viewer.
member.remarks: This updatable field is not required when creating a User, and has a default setting

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.UserFieldNames.CanChangeDocumentViewer
member.summary: Indicates whether a user can change the Document Viewer

member.summary: Indicates if Create should succeed when warning messages are returned.

member.summary: Indicates whether the field allows HTML code to execute within the field.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.FieldFieldNames.FriendlyName
member.summary: Provides a user-friendly label for a relational field.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.FieldFieldNames.AvailableInFieldTree
member.summary: Indicates whether the field and its choices are displayed in the Field Tree browser.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.FieldFieldNames.AllowGroupBy
member.summary: Indicates whether the field can be used for grouping in Relativity Pivot.

member.summary: Indicates whether the field is available in Relativity Pivot.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.FieldFieldNames.AvailableInViewer
member.summary: Indicates whether the field is displayed in the viewer.
member.remarks: This setting is only editable for long text fields with a Document object. It allows the reviewer to check text against the original document or image.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.FieldFieldNames.AutoAddChoices
member.summary: Indicates whether all choices associated with a Single or Multiple Choice field are added to an application.
member.remarks: This property is read-only.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.FieldFieldNames.ObjectType
member.summary: Determines the object that Relativity uses to classify the field.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.FieldFieldNames.FilterType
member.summary: Determines the filter type available for the field.
member.remarks: This property is read-only. Available filter types are None or List. A List filters a drop-down list of all values assigned to the field in a workspace, and allows the user to select one for filtering. This property is only used for Single Choice lists and Yes/No fields.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.FieldFieldNames.Linked
member.summary: Indicates if the field is set as a hyperlink.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.FieldFieldNames.Width
member.summary: Indicates the width (in pixels) of the column displaying the field's contents in a view. Must be a numeric value passed as a string.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.FieldFieldNames.Wrapping
member.summary: Indicates whether the text in a field is displayed in multiple lines.
member.remarks: When set to Yes, the text is a field is wrapped into multiple lines.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.FieldFieldNames.YesValue
member.summary: Determines how the text for yes values for a Field of type Yes/No is displayed.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.FieldFieldNames.NoValue

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.FieldFieldNames.AllowSortTally
member.summary: Indicates whether the field can be used to sort document lists.

member.remarks: This property is read-only. Date fields can be displayed with a date or date and time format. Whole Number fields can be displayed with commas.

member.remarks: Values can replace or be appended to the existing values.

member.summary: The string names of fields used on Groups.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.GroupFieldNames.GroupType
member.summary:
Represents a specific category of users, such as system administrators.
Value Description
1 System Administrators
2 System Group
4 Everyone
5 Relativity Script Administrators
member.remarks: Use 2 (System Group) to create a new group. Constants have been defined for these values.

member.summary: Returns an integer ID representing the resource pool.
member.remarks: Additional information about a resource pool can be obtained by checking the database for mappings to servers and file repositories associated with it.

member.summary: Represents the ArtifactID of the server used to cache files for a workspace.
member.remarks: >The default cache location server temporarily stores the natives, images, and productions used by the viewer. The corresponding property on the Workspace DTO returns the ArtifactID of the server.

member.name: T:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.TabFieldNames
member.summary: The string names of fields used on Tabs.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.TabFieldNames.Name
member.summary: Represents the name of the tab.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.TabFieldNames.RelativityApplications
member.summary: Represents a Multiple Object field specifying Relativity Application objects associated with this Tab.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.TabFieldNames.Order
member.summary: Uses numerical value to indicate the position of the tab.
member.remarks: The value of this property can be any positive or negative integer. The tab with the lowest value is the leftmost tab, while the highest-numbered tab is rightmost. Tabs with the same value are sorted in alphanumeric order.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.TabFieldNames.ExternalLink
member.summary: Provides a URL with the full web address for a tab with LinkType set to External.
member.remarks: When users click on this tab, they are taken to this external URL.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.TabFieldNames.IsDefault
member.summary: Indicates whether the tab is the default workspace tab.
member.remarks: When reviewers log in to a workspace, they are taken to the default tab. If they do not have access to the tab, they are directed to the Documents tab.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.TabFieldNames.ObjectType
member.summary: Represents the object type of the items displayed on the tab in Relativity.
member.remarks: This type is NULL for a parent tab or a tab identified as external link.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.TabFieldNames.LinkType
member.summary: Indicates the type of the tab.
member.remarks:
The following table lists available values:
Value Meaning
Object A tab that displays a table of Artifacts.
External Link A tab that displays a URL for an internal or external website, or another page in Relativity.
Parent A parent tab that displays as a drop-down list of its child tabs.

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.TabFieldNames.TabDisplay
member.summary: Indicates how the tab is displayed.
member.remarks:
Parent tabs are set to 0, while most other tabs do not have a value for this property. contains specific values used by this property. The following table lists available values:
Value Description
0 Vertical
1 Horizontal

member.name: F:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.TabFieldNames.IsVisible
member.summary: Indicates whether the tab is visible in Relativity.

member.summary: Indicates whether related items should be returned in the result set. When related items are returned, it also indicates which relational field should be used in the search.
member.remarks: This field must be configured in the workspace as a relational field. In addition, the value of the RelationalField property must be a field name, such as “Group Identifier”. member.name: T:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.Tab
member.summary: Represents a tab in Relativity.
member.remarks: The Tab DTO supports the read and query operations.

member.name: M:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.Tab.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.Tab.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the given ArtifactID.
member.param: An integer that uniquely identifier a Tab.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.Tab.Name
member.summary: Represents the name of the tab.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.Tab.Order
member.summary: Uses numerical value to indicate the position of the tab.
member.remarks: The value of this property can be any positive or negative integer. The tab with the lowest value is the leftmost tab, while the highest-numbered tab is rightmost. Tabs with the same value are sorted in alphanumeric order.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.Tab.ExternalLink
member.summary: Provides a URL with the full web address for a tab with LinkType set to External.
member.remarks: When users click on this tab, they are taken to this external URL.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.Tab.IsDefault
member.summary: Indicates whether the tab is the default workspace tab.
member.remarks: When reviewers log in to a workspace, they are taken to the default tab. If they do not have access to the tab, they are directed to the Documents tab.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.Tab.ObjectType
member.summary: Represents the object type of the items displayed on the tab in Relativity.
member.remarks: This type is NULL for a parent tab or a tab identified as external link.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.Tab.RelativityApplications
member.summary: Represents a Multiple Object field specifying Relativity Application objects associated with this Tab.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.Tab.TabDisplay
member.summary: Indicates how the tab is displayed.
member.remarks:
Parent tabs are set to 0, while most other tabs do not have a value for this property. contains specific values used by this property. The following table lists available values:
Value Description
0 Vertical
1 Horizontal

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.Tab.LinkType
member.summary: Indicates the type of the tab.
member.remarks:
The following table lists available values:
Value Meaning
Object A tab that displays a table of Artifacts.
External Link A tab that displays a URL for an internal or external website, or another page in Relativity.
Parent A parent tab that displays as a drop-down list of its child tabs.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.Tab.IsVisible
member.summary: Indicates whether the tab is visible in Relativity.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.ProgressEventArgs.CancelTransfer
member.summary: A boolean value that indicates when a transfer should be cancelled.
member.remarks: This value is set when calling a transfer. After a Progress event is raised, the CancelTransfer property is inspected. When it is set to False, the operation in progress continues, while a value of True stops the operation (and cleans up associated resources). A Cancel event is raised afterwards..

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.ProgressEventArgs.KBytesTransferred
member.summary: Indicates the number of kilobytes (KBs) transferred during an upload or download operation.

member.summary: Indicates the amount of progress completed for the operation.

member.name: T:kCura.Relativity.Client.CertificateFindValueInvalidException
member.summary: The CertificateFindValueInvalidException is thrown when there is a mismatch between the server-defined CertificateFindValue and the user-supplied CertificateFindValue.
member.remarks: At login, the CertificateFindValueInvalidException is thrown when an invalid client-side CertificateFindValue is defined through the ArtifactManagerSettings class or in an app.config file. The initial login attempt fails even though the invalid CertificateFindValue allows the creation of the ArtifactManagerProxy.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.CertificateFindValueInvalidException.ServerSuppliedCertificateFindValue
member.summary: Represents the CertificateFindValue defined on the server.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.CertificateFindValueInvalidException.UserSuppliedCertificateFindValue
member.summary: Gets or set the CertificateFindValue supplied by the client through the ArtifactManagerSettings object or in an app.config file.

member.name: T:kCura.Relativity.Client.CertificateFindValueNotSuppliedException
member.summary: The CertificateFindValueNotSuppliedException is thrown when no CertificateFindValue is supplied, but all requested EndpointType values require it.
member.remarks: This exception is stored in the EndpointTypeExceptions property when the client-side CertificateFindValue has not been defined for the EndpointType values. These EndpointType values are ignored when the Services API attempts to make a connection. The EndpointTypeExceptions property is available on the EndpointTypeCollectionInvalidException object and on the ServiceInformation object.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.CertificateFindValueNotSuppliedException.DesiredEndpointType
member.summary: Gets and sets the EndpointType value ignored due to a missing CertificateFindValue.

member.name: T:kCura.Relativity.Client.CrudFailureException
member.summary: This exception will be thrown when the API experiences a serious problem during a CRUD (Create, Read, Update, or Delete) operation.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.CrudFailureException.Message
member.summary: The Message property will contain more information about the underlying problem.

member.name: M:kCura.Relativity.Client.CrudFailureException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The message.

member.name: T:kCura.Relativity.Client.EndpointTypeCollectionInvalidException
member.summary: This exception is thrown when the endpoint connection fails during the construction of the ArtifactManagerProxy and FileTransferProxy.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.EndpointTypeCollectionInvalidException.DesiredEndpointTypes
member.summary: Provides an EndpointType collection used for establishing a connection with the Service API.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.EndpointTypeCollectionInvalidException.EndpointTypeExceptions
member.summary: A collection that maps the metadata scheme of the EndpointType value to the exception.
member.remarks: This collection contains data used to troubleshoot connection issues. The outer key is either http or https, representing the protocol used to expose the service metadata, not the actual endpoint configuration. It is the mapping of EndpointType values to the exception thrown when a connection attempt occurred. The inner collection key is the EndpointType value used to create a connection with the corresponding value of the inner key representing the specific exception thrown.

member.name: T:kCura.Relativity.Client.FileTransferProxy
member.summary: Performs operations on file fields in Relativity, including downloading, clearing, and uploading files.
member.remarks: The FileTransferProxy class is provided in the kCura.Relativity.Client.dll. It is used for populating, clearing, and reading from a file field. The process for constructing an instance of this class is the same as for the ArtifactManagerProxy class.

member.name: M:kCura.Relativity.Client.FileTransferProxy.#ctor(System.Uri,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{kCura.Relativity.Client.EndpointType},kCura.Relativity.Client.FileTransferSettings)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the FileTransferProxy class with a URI specifying the location of the FileTransfer service a collection of EndpointType values for the connection, and configuration values used to override client-side settings.
member.param: URL, like http://services.kcura.com/relativity.services/, that houses the metadata.
The endpoint types to use for connecting.
The single-value configuration settings to override app.config.
member.remarks: Use the following format to specify the URI for the FileTransfer service: https://servernameorURL/Relativity.Services/. The FileTransferProxy attempts to connect to the FileTransfer service using each supplied EndpointType in the specified order until establishing a connection, or until no more EndpointType values remain in the collection. The values provided by the FileTransferSettings object override those in the app.config file.

member.name: M:kCura.Relativity.Client.FileTransferProxy.#ctor(System.Uri,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{kCura.Relativity.Client.EndpointType})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the FileTransferProxy class with a URI specifying the location of the FileTransfer service and a collection of EndpointType values for the connection.
member.param: URL, like http://services.kcura.com/relativity.services/, that houses the metadata.
The endpoint types to use for connecting.
member.remarks: The FileTransferProxy attempts to connect to the FileTransfer service using each supplied EndpointType in the specified order until establishing a connection, or until no more EndpointType values remain in the collection.

member.param: Name of the machine, like dv-dsk-myBox.kcura.corp, that houses the metadata.
The endpoint types to use for connecting.
The single-value configuration settings to override app.config.
member.remarks: The FileTransferProxy attempts to connect to the FileTransfer service using each supplied EndpointType in the specified order until establishing a connection, or until no more EndpointType values remain in the collection. The values provided by the FileTransferSettings object override those in the app.config file.

member.name: M:kCura.Relativity.Client.RSAPIClient.MassEdit(kCura.Relativity.Client.APIOptions,kCura.Relativity.Client.ArtifactRequest,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int32})
member.summary: Updates Documents with Field values from a template.
member.param: The APIOptions object containing the login token from the Login() call and the workspace ID.
An ArtifactRequest with a set of Fields whose values will be applied to each Artifact.
The ArtifactID of each item that will be edited.
member.returns: MassOperationResult indicating the status of the MassEdit operation.
member.remarks: The MassEdit method is useful for updating Documents with Fields that need to be set to the same values. It reduces network traffic by taking a list of ArtifactIDs rather than ArtifactRequests.

member.name: M:kCura.Relativity.Client.RSAPIClient.MassCreate(kCura.Relativity.Client.APIOptions,kCura.Relativity.Client.ArtifactRequest,System.Collections.Generic.List{kCura.Relativity.Client.ArtifactRequest})
member.summary: Creates new custom objects in bulk using Field values provided by a template Artifact.
member.remarks: MassCreate has a template Artifact, which includes a list of Fields defining each new object. In the template Artifact, the Fields are default values that can be overridden by providing a different value for a specific custom object. The template ensures that the fields are not repeated in the SOAP message. A custom object instance is created for each ArtifactRequest in the ArtifactRequests list.
member.param: The APIOptions object containing the login token from the Login() call and the workspace ID.
An ArtifactRequest with a set of fields providing default values.
A list of ArtifactRequests to be created. An RDO will be created for each ArtifactRequest in the list.
member.returns: MassOperationResult indicating the status of the MassCreate operation.

member.name: M:kCura.Relativity.Client.RSAPIClient.MassCreateWithDetails(kCura.Relativity.Client.APIOptions,kCura.Relativity.Client.ArtifactRequest,System.Collections.Generic.List{kCura.Relativity.Client.ArtifactRequest})
member.summary: Creates new custom objects in bulk using Field values provided by a template Artifact. The results contain the IDs for the created artifacts.
member.remarks: MassCreate has a template Artifact, which includes a list of Fields defining each new object. In the template Artifact, the Fields are default values that can be overridden by providing a different value for a specific custom object. The template ensures that the fields are not repeated in the SOAP message. A custom object instance is created for each ArtifactRequest in the ArtifactRequests list.
member.param: The APIOptions object containing the login token from the Login() call, and the workspace ID.
An ArtifactRequest with a set of fields providing default values
A list of ArtifactRequests to be created. An RDO will be created for each ArtifactRequest in the list.
member.returns: MassOperationResult indicating the status of the MassCreate operation

member.name: M:kCura.Relativity.Client.RSAPIClient.MassCreateWithAPIParameters(kCura.Relativity.Client.APIOptions,kCura.Relativity.Client.ArtifactRequest,System.Collections.Generic.List{kCura.Relativity.Client.ArtifactRequest},System.Collections.Generic.List{kCura.Relativity.Client.APIParameters})
member.summary: MassCreate will create RDO instances based upon the Field values provided by a 'template' ArtifactRequest. The template provides the default values. An RDO instance will be created for each ArtifactRequest in the ArtifactRequests list. Any field values provided in an ArtifactRequest will override the defaults provided by the template ArtifactRequest.
member.param: The APIOptions object containing the login token from the Login() call, and the workspace ID
An ArtifactRequest with a set of fields providing default values
A list of ArtifactRequests to be created. An RDO will be created for each ArtifactRequest in the list.
A list of any number and type of additional parameters that API might require.
member.returns: MassOperationResult indicating the status of the MassCreate operation
member.remarks: Only the Fields defined in the template will be populated in the created RDO instances. Any Field defined in an ArtifactRequest which is not also in the template will be ignored. All RDO instances must be of the same ArtifactType
