member.name: M:kCura.Relativity.Client.RSAPIClient.Query(kCura.Relativity.Client.APIOptions,kCura.Relativity.Client.Query,System.Int32)
member.summary: Queries Relativity to find Artifacts matching the selection criteria.
member.remarks: A Query object describes the search and sorting criteria to use for objects of a given ArtifactType. It can return all or a specific sub-set of fields. The parameter specifies how many results to return in the first QueryResult object.
member.param: The APIOptions object containing the login token from the Login() call and the workspace ID.
The Query object that indicates the query to execute.
The maximum number of artifacts to return. Additional results may be fetched by calling QuerySubset.
member.returns: A QueryResult. If the given ArtifactType supports paging, the QueryResult will provide the first length number of items to which the Query applies. Otherwise, all such items will be returned. If more than length search results are available and paging is supported, the QueryResult.QueryToken property will be set.

member.name: M:kCura.Relativity.Client.RSAPIClient.QuerySubset(kCura.Relativity.Client.APIOptions,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Fetches search results not returned in the first call to Query.
member.remarks: When a Query returns a large amount of data about an ArtifactType that supports paging, this method returns the first page of data and provides a QueryToken. Subsequent pages of data are retrieved by passing a QueryToken to a QuerySubset call.
member.param: The APIOptions object containing the login token from the Login() call and the workspace ID.
The query token value provided in the QueryResult.
The starting index used to select a subset of Artifacts from the List of all Artifacts that satisfy the initial Query() call. The List index starts with 1.
The number of results to return.
member.returns: QueryResult

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.SettingsConfig.MaxArrayLength
member.summary: Indicates the maximum length of arrays created and returned at various stages of message processing. Set to 1000000 by default.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.SettingsConfig.MaxBufferSize
member.summary: Specifies the maximum buffer size (in bytes) used to store messages in memory. Set to 104857600 bytes by default.
member.remarks: When the amount of data received exceeds the buffer size, the data remains on the underlying socket until there is room in the buffer. The MaxBufferSize should match the value of MaxReceivedMessageSize.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.SettingsConfig.MaxBufferPoolSize
member.summary: Specifies maximum size (in bytes) of the buffer pool used by the BufferManager. Set to 104857600 bytes by default.
member.remarks: Buffers are required to process messages as they come out of a channel. If the BufferManager has insufficient memory, allocate additional memory.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.SettingsConfig.MaxConnectionRetries
member.summary: The maximum number of connection retries. Set to 5 by default
member.remarks: Any negative value is treated as infinity, and is not recommended.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.SettingsConfig.MaxDepth
member.summary: Specifies the maximum node depth. Set to 200 by default.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.SettingsConfig.MaxReceivedMessageSize
member.summary: Specifies the maximum size (in bytes) of a message that will be processed by the Service API. Set to 104857600 bytes by default.
member.remarks: The MaxReceivedMessageSize helps limit denial-of-service (DoS) attacks. The value should be large enough to accommodate larger message payloads.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.SettingsConfig.MaxStringContentLength
member.summary: Specifies the maximum string length returned by the XML reader. Set to 104857600 by default.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.SettingsConfig.SendTimeout
member.summary: Specifies the length of time that a connection can be inactive before it drops. Set to 10 minutes by default.
member.remarks: The SendTimeout property represents the length of time between sending a message and receiving a reply that a client waits.

(This is compatible with the 7.5 behavior.) If the flag to return artifactIDs is set to True, then every Result object will have a Success property set to True/False. If the property is false, the message will contain an error. If the property is set to true, the result will include an artifactID.

member.name: T:kCura.Relativity.Client.MultiChoiceUpdateValue
member.summary: Describes the value and behavior used to update a MultiChoice field.
member.remarks: The MultiChoiceUpdateValue object is used as a parameter when creating or updating a MultiChoice field. It takes a Value property as a List of ArtifactID objects or ValueAsGuid as a List of GUIDs, which representing a Choice Artifacts. This class also includes constructors for instantiating objects with single GUIDS representing different Choice Artifacts. The Behavior property specifies the use of Replace or Merge operations for updating values. The Merge behavior adds a new value to the MultiChoice field, while Replace overrides them. For example, when the MultiChoiceUpdateValue object has a Value of yellow, and a Behavior of Merge, a document with MultiChoice field called color with a value of Red will be updated to include Red and Yellow values. When the MultiChoiceUpdateValue object has a Value of Green, and a Behavior of Replace, the same document with a value of Red will be updated to have only the value Green because the previous values are overwritten.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.MultiChoiceUpdateValue.Value
member.summary: Indicates the value applied to MultiChoice Field.
member.value: The value as a List of Int of Choice Artifact IDs

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.MultiChoiceUpdateValue.ValueAsGuid
member.summary: Provides a list of identifiers for new choice values used for updating a MultiChoice Field. Each List of GUID must represent a Choice Artifact.
member.value: The choice values as a List containing Lists of Guids that represent the Choice Artifact IDs

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.MultiChoiceUpdateValue.Behavior
member.summary: Provides the MultiChoiceUpdateBehavior Enum indicating the behavior (Replace or Merge) used to update a Field.
member.value: The update behavior, either Merge or Replace

member.name: T:kCura.Relativity.Client.MultiRelativityApplicationUpdateValue
member.summary: Describes the value and behavior used to update a MultiRelativityApplication field.
member.remarks: The MultiRelativityApplicationUpdateValue object is used as a parameter when creating or updating a MultiRelativityApplication field. It takes a Value property as a List of ArtifactID objects or ValueAsGuid as a List of GUIDs, which representing a RelativityApplication Artifacts. This class also includes constructors for instantiating objects with single GUIDS representing different RelativityApplication Artifacts. The Behavior property specifies the use of Replace or Merge operations for updating values. The Merge behavior adds a new value to the MultiRelativityApplication field, while Replace overrides them. For example, when the MultiRelativityApplicationUpdateValue object has a Value of yellow, and a Behavior of Merge, a document with MultiRelativityApplication field called color with a value of Red will be updated to include Red and Yellow values. When the MultiRelativityApplicationUpdateValue object has a Value of Green, and a Behavior of Replace, the same document with a value of Red will be updated to have only the value Green because the previous values are overwritten.

member.name: T:kCura.Relativity.Client.MultiUpdateValue
member.summary: Describes the value and behavior update (Remove, Add, or Replace) used to update certain MultiObject fields.
member.remarks: When calling Update or Create on Groups, the MultiUpdateValue object is passed as a parameter for updates to User fields. The Value property is a list of integers representing the User IDs that must be applied to the field. The Behavior property is determined by a MultiUpdateBehavior Enum, which specifies how the Value property should be applied to a field. Behaviors include Replace, Add, or Remove.

member.name: M:kCura.Relativity.Client.MultiUpdateValue.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int32},kCura.Relativity.Client.MultiUpdateBehavior)
member.summary: Instantiates a new, empty MultiUpdateValue object
member.param: The IDs the MultiObject Field should be set to, have added to it, or have removed from it, depending on how the behavior is set.
The update behavior, either Replace, Add, or Remove

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.Query.ArtifactTypeID
member.summary: Indicates the identifier for the object to query on. Enumeration contains these identifiers. Use as an alternative to ArtifactTypeName or ArtifactTypeGuid.
member.remarks: To search for documents, use an ArtifactTypeID of 10. Custom objects have ArtifactTypeIDs that vary from workspace to workspace, so it may be more convenient to use the ArtifactTypeName or ArtifactTypeGuid properties.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.Query.ArtifactTypeName
member.summary: Indicates the name of the Artifact type to query on. Use as an alternative to ArtifactTypeID.
member.remarks: To search for documents, use Document as the ArtifactTypeName.
member.value: The name of the artifact type.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.Query.ArtifactTypeGuid
member.summary: Indicates the GUID for the type of an item to query on. Use as an alternative to specifying either the ArtifactTypeID or ArtifactTypeName.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.Query.Fields
member.summary: Provides a collection of Field objects that should be returned by the query.
member.remarks: To return all fields, leave Fields collection empty. Return a subset by specifying the required Fields. For example, if you need only the ArtifactID, include only this field.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.Query.Condition
member.summary: Provides search criteria. It can be a simple, single-field condition, or a complex expression combining multiple conditions.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.Query.Sorts
member.summary: Provides a list of Sort objects indicate how the results are organized.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.Query.RelationalField
member.summary: Identifies the Relational field used when searching.
member.remarks: The Field identifier must be configured in a workspace as a Relational field.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.Query.RowCondition
member.summary: Provides row search criteria. It can be a simple, single-field condition, or a complex expression combining multiple conditions. This criteria will limit the result set returned after applying all other conditions and including the relational field. Currently, this property will only work for the Pivot and Object Query APIs.

member.summary: Represents the outcome of an individual Read operation on a single Artifact.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.ReadResult.Success
member.summary: Indicates the status of a Read. Value set to True when the request succeeds.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.ReadResult.Artifact
member.summary: Indicates the Artifact of the item that was read.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.ReadResult.Message
member.summary: Provides a description of an error when a Read failure occurs.

member.name: T:kCura.Relativity.Client.ReadResultSet
member.summary: Provides the results of a Read operation.
member.remarks: On the ReadResultSet object, the Success property indicates the overall status of the request, while the Status of individual Artifacts is in the ReadResults collection.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.ReadResultSet.Success
member.summary: Indicates the overall status of the set of Read operations. Value set to True when the request succeeds.
member.remarks: When Success is False, the individual Result objects in the Results collection indicate which requests failed.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.ReadResultSet.Message
member.summary: Provides a description of an error when a Read failure occurs.
member.remarks: The Message property is populated with errors returned by a Read operation. These messages use the following format with pipe characters as separators: “Request x of z: [error] | Request y of z: [error]”. x and y represent the indexes of the ReadResult error items, while z represents the total number of Artifact requests returned on a one to one basis as ReadResult objects. For example, a message would include this information: “Request 1 of 4: The following field was requested but not found: PasswordHash.”

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.ReadResultSet.ReadResults
member.summary: Provides a collection of ReadResult objects that contain the output of each individual operation.

member.name: M:kCura.Relativity.Client.ReadResultSet.ValidateSuccess
member.summary: If any of the inner results are False, adjust the outer result to be False

member.name: M:kCura.Relativity.Client.Repositories.GenericRepository`1.Read(System.Int32[])
member.summary: Reads the specified Artifacts. For each Artifact, all fields will be returned.
member.param: A collection of the ArtifactIDs of the Artifacts to be read.
member.returns: Returns a ResultSet containing the specified Artifacts.
member.remarks:
If you want to Read an RDO, you need to use the overload that takes a list of Artifacts because that will allow you to specify both ArtifactTypeID (or ArtifactTypeName) and ArtifactID.
You should also use the overload that takes a list of Artifacts if you want to specify which fields should be returned. If you use this method, all fields will be returned.

member.name: M:kCura.Relativity.Client.Repositories.GenericRepository`1.Query(kCura.Relativity.Client.DTOs.Query{`0},System.Int32)
member.summary: Queries Relativity to find Artifacts matching the selection criteria.
member.param: The Query object that indicates the query to execute.
The maximum number of Artifacts to return. Additional results may be fetched by calling QuerySubset.
member.returns: A set of QueryResult objects that provides the first length number of Artifacts. If more than length search results are available, the QueryResult.QueryToken property will be set.
member.remarks: The parameter is only taken into account when the ArtifactType queried over is Document, RDO, Relativity Application, or Batch. Length is also used when the condition is a ViewCondition. In all other cases, all Artifacts will be returned in a single QueryResultSet without paging.

member.name: M:kCura.Relativity.Client.Repositories.GenericRepository`1.QuerySubset(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Fetches additional search results after a call to Query.
member.remarks: When a Query returns a large amount of data of a type that supports paging, this method returns the first page of data and provides a QueryToken. The only way to retrieve subsequent pages of data is by passing a QueryToken to a QuerySubset call.
member.param: The query token value provided in the QueryResult.
The starting index used to select a subset of Artifacts from the List of all Artifacts that satisfy the initial Query() call. The List index starts with 1.
The maximum number of results to return.
member.returns: A QueryResultSet containing up to length search results.

member.name: M:kCura.Relativity.Client.Repositories.GenericRepository`1.MassEdit(`0,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int32})
member.summary: Applies the Field values from the 'template' artifact to each of the Artifacts identified by the array of ArtifactIDs.
member.param: An Artifact with a set of Fields holding Field values to be applied to each Artifact.
The ArtifactID of each item that will be edited.
member.returns: A WriteResultSet indicating the status of the MassEdit operation.
member.remarks: The only ArtifactType currently supported is Document.

member.name: M:kCura.Relativity.Client.Repositories.GenericRepository`1.MassCreate(`0,System.Collections.Generic.List{`0})
member.summary: Creates RDO instances for each ArtifactRequest in based on the Field values provided by a 'template' ArtifactRequest.
member.param: An Artifact with a set of fields providing default values
A list of Artifacts to be created. An RDO will be created for each Artifact in the list.
member.returns: WriteResultSet indicating the status of the MassCreate operation
member.remarks:
The template provides the default values. Any field values provided in an ArtifactRequest will override the defaults provided by the template ArtifactRequest.
Only the Fields defined in the template will be populated in the created RDO instances. Any Field defined in an Artifact which is not also in the template will be ignored. All RDO instances must be of the same ArtifactType.

member.name: T:kCura.Relativity.Client.Repositories.GroupRepository
member.summary: The GroupRepository contains methods which apply to Groups.

remarks.para: System administrators can retrieve data about all groups in Relativity when they perform read or query operations.

When users who are not system administrators query for all groups without specifying a condition, the read and query operations return only information about the groups that include them as members. If the query includes a condition, information about any other groups is filtered out and only their assigned groups are returned. For these users, the properties returned on their groups are limited to ArtifactID, Name, and GroupType.

member.name: T:kCura.Relativity.Client.Repositories.UserRepository
member.summary: The UserRepository contains methods which apply to Users.

remarks.para: System administrators can retrieve data about all users in Relativity when they perform read or query operations.

When users who are not system administrators query for all users without specifying a condition, the read and query operations only return their individual information. The properties returned on the individual’s User object is only a subset of the available settings, which includes those available to non-administrative users in the Relativity web UI, as well as a list of groups that include the user as a member. The group objects will only contain the group Artifact IDs, which a user can then use to query for group names. If the query includes a condition, information about any other users is filtered out, and only their individual information is returned as previously described.

member.summary: Provides information about the services that comprise the ArtifactManagerProxy.
member.remarks: To retrieve a ServiceInformation object containing data for a specific service, call the indexer property on the ArtifactManagerProxy class with the ServiceType value. The ServiceInformation class includes events from the ICommunicationObject interface.

member.summary: Indicates the endpoint type used to create the proxy.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.ServiceInformation.DefaultServiceAPIPath
member.summary: Indicates the relative part of the URI containing the Services API path.
member.remarks: This property provides the default installation information for the Relativity Services API. It retrieves the Relative part of the URI used in combination with the serverName, which is passed to an ArtifactManagerProxy constructor to specify a metadata endpoint address.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.ServiceInformation.EndpointTypeExceptions
member.summary: Retrieves a collection containing detailed information about a proxy construction that failed. The collection maps the metadata scheme of the EndpointType value to the exception.
member.remarks: This collection contains data used to troubleshoot connection issues. The outer key is either http or https, representing the protocol used to expose the service metadata. It is the mapping of EndpointType values to the exception thrown when a connection attempt occurred. The inner collection key is the EndpointType value used to create a connection with the corresponding value of the inner key representing the specific exception thrown.

member.name: T:kCura.Relativity.Client.ArtifactManagerSettings
member.summary: Provides the capability for programmatically applying client-side overrides to configuration settings for the ArtifactManagerProxy.
member.remarks: The ArtifactManagerSettings object is passed to the constructor of ArtifactManagerProxy. It provides the configuration settings that take precedence over values supplied in an app.config file. For example, you may want to use this object for configuration overrides when using an Event Handler.

member.name: T:kCura.Relativity.Client.FileTransferSettings
member.summary: The FileTransferSettings object is passed to the constructor of FileTransferProxy. It provides the configuration settings that take precedence over values supplied in an app.config file. For example, you may want to use this object for configuration overrides when using an Event Handler.

member.name: M:kCura.Relativity.Client.FileTransferSettings.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor containing the default values for FileTransfer.

member.name: T:kCura.Relativity.Client.ProxySettings
member.summary: Abstract base class providing settings for controlling connections to Relativity.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.ProxySettings.CertificateFindValue
member.summary: Sets flag indicating that the client validates the server certificate using the CertificateFindValue.
member.remarks: When CertificateValidation is true, the client must trust the certificate on the server. By default, this value is false.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.ProxySettings.CertificateValidation
member.summary: If 'true', perform client-side certificate validation.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.ProxySettings.UpnIdentity
member.summary: If populated, this property should match the Identity in the ApplicationPool of Relativity.Services. Setting this value means that a WCF service with this identity will be trusted by this client.
member.remarks: This property is used only for Integrated Authentication over HTTPS with Kerberos authentication protocol.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.ProxySettings.MaxArrayLength
member.summary: Indicates the maximum length of arrays created and returned at various stages of message processing. Set to 1000000 by default.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.ProxySettings.MaxBufferSize
member.summary: Specifies the maximum buffer size (in bytes) used to store messages in memory. Set to 104857600 bytes by default.
member.remarks: When the amount of data received exceeds the buffer size, the data remains on the underlying socket until there is room in the buffer. The MaxBufferSize should match the value of MaxReceivedMessageSize.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.ProxySettings.MaxBufferPoolSize
member.summary: Specifies maximum size (in bytes) of the buffer pool used by the BufferManager. Set to 104857600 bytes by default.
member.remarks: Buffers are required to process messages as they come out of a channel. If the BufferManager has insufficient memory, allocate additional memory.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.ProxySettings.MaxConnectionRetries
member.summary: The maximum number of connection retries. Set to 5 by default.
member.remarks: Any negative input allows infinite retries. This is not recommended.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.ProxySettings.MaxDepth
member.summary: Specifies the maximum node depth. Set to 200 by default.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.ProxySettings.MaxReceivedMessageSize
member.summary: Specifies the maximum size (in bytes) of a message that will be processed by the Service API. Set to 104857600 bytes by default.
member.remarks: The MaxReceivedMessageSize helps limit denial-of-service (DoS) attacks. The value should be large enough to accommodate larger message payloads.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.ProxySettings.MaxStringContentLength
member.summary: Specifies the maximum string length returned by the XML reader. Set to 104857600 by default.

member.name: P:kCura.Relativity.Client.ProxySettings.SendTimeout
member.summary: Specifies the length of time that a connection can be inactive before it drops. Set to 10 minutes by default.
member.remarks: The SendTimeout property represents the maximum length of time a client will wait between sending a message and receiving a reply.

member.name: T:kCura.Relativity.Client.TargetField

member.returns: Returns an array of Artifact objects.

member.name: M:Relativity.SDK.Services.Interfaces.IDataManipulation.MassEdit(kCura.Relativity.Client.APIOptions,kCura.Relativity.Client.ArtifactRequest,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int32})
member.summary: MassEdit will apply the Field values from the 'template' ArtifactRequest to each of the Artifacts identfied by the array of ArtifactIDs.
member.param: The APIOptions object containing the login token from the Login() call, and the workspace ID
An ArtifactRequest with a set of Fields from which the Field values will be applied to each Artifact
The ArtifactID of each item that will be edited
member.returns: MassOperationResult indicating the status of the MassEdit operation
member.remarks: Currently works on Documents only, no other ArtifactType supported

member.name: M:Relativity.SDK.Services.Interfaces.IDataManipulation.MassCreate(kCura.Relativity.Client.APIOptions,kCura.Relativity.Client.ArtifactRequest,System.Collections.Generic.List{kCura.Relativity.Client.ArtifactRequest})
member.summary: MassCreate will create RDO instances based upon the Field values provided by a 'template' ArtifactRequest. The template provides the default values. An RDO instance will be created for each ArtifactRequest in the ArtifactRequests list. Any field values provided in an ArtifactRequest will override the defaults provided by the template ArtifactRequest.
member.param: The APIOptions object containing the login token from the Login() call, and the workspace ID
An ArtifactRequest with a set of fields providing default values
A list of ArtifactRequests to be created. An RDO will be created for each ArtifactRequest in the list.
member.returns: MassOperationResult indicating the status of the MassCreate operation
member.remarks: Only the Fields defined in the template will be populated in the created RDO instances. Any Field defined in an ArtifactRequest which is not also in the template will be ignored. All RDO instances must be of the same ArtifactType

member.name: M:Relativity.SDK.Services.Interfaces.IDataManipulation.MassCreateWithDetails(kCura.Relativity.Client.APIOptions,kCura.Relativity.Client.ArtifactRequest,System.Collections.Generic.List{kCura.Relativity.Client.ArtifactRequest})
member.summary: Creates new custom objects in bulk using Field values provided by a template Artifact. The results contain the IDs for the created artifacts.
member.remarks: MassCreate has a template Artifact, which includes a list of Fields defining each new object. In the template Artifact, the Fields are default values that can be overridden by providing a different value for a specific custom object. The template ensures that the fields are not repeated in the SOAP message. A custom object instance is created for each ArtifactRequest in the ArtifactRequests list.
member.param: The APIOptions object containing the login token from the Login() call, and the workspace ID.
An ArtifactRequest with a set of fields providing default values
A list of ArtifactRequests to be created. An RDO will be created for each ArtifactRequest in the list.
member.returns: MassOperationResult indicating the status of the MassCreate operation

member.summary: MassCreateWithAPIParameters will create RDO instances based upon the Field values provided by a 'template' ArtifactRequest. The template provides the default values. An RDO instance will be created for each ArtifactRequest in the ArtifactRequests list. Any field values provided in an ArtifactRequest will override the defaults provided by the template ArtifactRequest.
member.param: The APIOptions object containing the login token from the Login() call, and the workspace ID
An ArtifactRequest with a set of fields providing default values
A list of ArtifactRequests to be created. An RDO will be created for each ArtifactRequest in the list.
A list of any number and type of additional parameters that API might require.
member.returns: MassOperationResult indicating the status of the MassCreate operation
member.remarks: Only the Fields defined in the template will be populated in the created RDO instances. Any Field defined in an ArtifactRequest which is not also in the template will be ignored. All RDO instances must be of the same ArtifactType
